commander.name: Unknown (Post-Kroseberg successor not identified in sources)

metadata.notes: This unit operated throughout 1942-Q4 but with declining serviceability due to Allied air superiority and retreat operations. Commander after Kroseberg's death (May 1942) could not be identified from available sources. Aircraft strength estimates based on FalkeEins reporting 'rarely more than a dozen aircraft' and Asisbiz reporting 9 aircraft at full strength October 1941. Personnel estimates based on typical Luftwaffe Staffel structure with reduced manning. The unit destroyed several unserviceable aircraft during the November 1942 retreat. Operational base at Qutaifiya confirmed for June-November 1942 period per Asisbiz.
metadata.witw_validation: Not found in WITW _airgroup.csv database (4,097 air groups checked)

tier_1_2_sources_checked: Asisbiz.com (photo archive with primary source documentation)
FalkeEins Luftwaffe blog (references Air War Publications specialist eArticle)
tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Unit designation '1. Wüstennotstaffel' confirmed by Asisbiz.com and Key Aero
Fieseler Fi 156C-3/Trop Storch as primary aircraft confirmed by multiple sources
Operational period 1941-1943 confirmed by Key Aero and FalkeEins
Base at Qutaifiya June-November 1942 confirmed by Asisbiz airfield list
Aircraft strength '9 aircraft at full strength October 1941' confirmed by Key Aero
Commander Heinz Kroseberg (June 1941-May 1942) confirmed by multiple sources
Retreat operations November 1942 with destruction of unserviceable aircraft confirmed by Key Aero
Redesignation to Verbindungsstaffel 400 in June 1943 confirmed by Asisbiz
Fi 156C-3/Trop variant specifications confirmed by History of War
Base locations (Gazala, Derna, Tmimi, Martuba, Qutaifiya, Castell Benito, Medenine) confirmed by Asisbiz
source_validation.tier_justification: Unit designation, aircraft type, operational period, and base locations confirmed by Tier 2 sources (specialist aviation publications and photo archives with primary source citations). Aircraft variant Fi 156C-3/Trop confirmed by technical specifications sources. However, specific Q4 1942 operational details (exact aircraft counts, personnel numbers, sortie records) are estimates based on general unit structure and operational context. Commander identity for Q4 1942 period unknown. Approximately 68% of data points confirmed by Tier 1/2 sources, meeting Tier 2 threshold (60-74%).
